content: the thing by meredith willmott instagram @the_leafhopper ravelry @leafhopperknits web www the-leafhopper com youtube @the-leafhopper contact meredithjwillmott@gmail com 1 notions introduction tape measure tapestry needle scissors ever want to knit something but don t know what gauge pick up a cute skein of yarn and you re certain it ll be 3 75mm 15 stitches and 20 row = 4 good for something someday well here s the thing gauge is calculated for the piece post-blocking initially this wasn t a pattern i was going to write up yardage but i made it once…twice…three times then my 250yds / 228m / 105g mum made one and honestly it s just kind of really fun to knit and wear so the thing is now released into sizes the world please enjoy the curl of the stockinette measurements are given post-blocking edge makes it really easy to tie and style in front and wear under a bulky coat or over a sweatshirt sizes 1 size fits all instructions for adjusting to a specific yarn weight meredith this exact pattern has been made before finished length 84 213cm you re stealing - let me stop you there i am sure this pattern has been knit before i am sure i did not invent finished width at point 12 30cm this in fact for a really long time i thought i was just abbreviations recreating the sherbet bandana another phenomenal free pattern look it up if you want it s a little less list of abbreviations all lowercase pathetic more defined in shape etc but enough k = knit people asked about the thing so now here it is written up it has not been tech edited it is wild and p = purl free k2togtbl knit 2 stitches together through the back materials loop m1r make one right yarn sl1pwise slip one purlwise with yarn in front jill draper makes stuff amalgam 4 76% welsh mountain black wool 24% targhee wool 270yds/247m/113g dk** **the amalgam colorways are different blends of welsh mountain black and targhee wool colors used in sample mc amalgam 4 needles us size 5 3 75mm 24 /16 circulars 2 directions introduction decrease section this scarf knits up with increases every other knit row and then knits down with decreases every other knit row 1 sl1pwisewyif k2togtbl k to last st row after a broad point row 2 sl1pwisewyif p to last st k1 row 3 sl1pwisewyif k to end if you want to adjust this pattern for any weight yarn row 4 sl1pwisewyif p to last st k1 here s how 1 weigh your yarn in grams 2 subtract 2g of yarn from your total then divide your total in repeat row 1-4 until you have 3 sts on your needles half for example if i have 100g of yarn i would after row 4 subtract 2 to give me 98g of yarn and then divide that resulting in 49g 3 work the increase section cast off with preferred
